alert.note: Alert for Crockett (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 4:46PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Crockett County through 530 PM CDT... At 446 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm in southwestern Crockett County, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2083 And Highway 405 and The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 405. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 346 and 362. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
